required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Laparoscopy for Endometriosis in Obese Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility and Safety of Endometriosis Laparoscopic Removal in Obese Patients: a Propensity Score Method Analysis

lead_sponsor.agency: Azienda Ospedaliera Universitaria di Bologna Policlinico S. Orsola Malpighi

clinical_study.source: Azienda Ospedaliera Universitaria di Bologna Policlinico S. Orsola Malpighi

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of surgical outcomes of endometriosis laparoscopic surgery in obese patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Obesity may influence surgical variables such as operative time, laparotomic conversion rate and intraoperative and postoperative complication rate. Moreover, it might influence the hospital length of stay. For that reason, the study aims to compare a group of obese patients with a non-obese group of patients about these topics.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Intraoperative: from the skin incision to the skin suture
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of operative time, expressed in minutes, between Group A and Group B

secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of laparotomic conversion rate between Group A and Group B

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Postoperative: from surgery to hospitalization discharge, assessed up to 30 days after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of hospital length of stay, expressed in days, between Group A and Group B

Comparison of intraoperative complication rate between Group A and Group B. Intraoperative complication rate is assessed using Clavien-Dindo Classification (from grade I to V, where I means any deviation from the normal postoperative course without the need for pharmacological treatment or surgical, endoscopic, and radiological interventions, and V means the death of a patient)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Postoperative: from surgery to hospitalization discharge, assessed up to 30 days after surgery.
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of postoperative complication rate between Group A and Group B. Postoperative complication rate is assessed using Clavien-Dindo Classification (from grade I to V, where I means any deviation from the normal postoperative course without the need for pharmacological treatment or surgical, endoscopic, and radiological interventions, and V means the death of a patient)

arm_group.description: Obese patients undergoing laparoscopic surgery for endometriosis
Non-obese patients undergoing laparoscopy for endometriosis

study_pop.textblock: Consecutive patients affected by endometriosis undergoing to laparoscopic endometriosis removal.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Obese patients undergoing endometriosis laparoscopic treatment
- Obteined Informed Consensus

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Azienda Ospedaliera Universitaria di Bologna Policlinico S. Orsola Malpighi
